page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW
page.content: This block of squares is on the dip slope of the Chilterns, close to London, and just north of the River Thames. The M40 motorway runs diagonally across the block from SE to NW. There is an extensive gravel extraction and landfill area in the NW of the block, and Bulstrode house in the NE of the block. Much of the NE corner is occupied by a part of Gerrards Cross, which consists mainly of expensive detached housing. The green southern part of the block is farmland, both arable and pastoral. In the middle of this green area is the rather scattered village of Hedgerley.
